text: Have you heard of transhumanism? If not, we believe that you should have. For us, transhumanism is of the utmost importance to the evolution of humanity and the continual growth of the human race, due to the present, near future and long term threats that society is facing. Transhumanism will be the key to our survival and we all need to get on board before it's too late. We're going to convince you today on why transhumanism is our last hope. Transhumanism has infinite possibilities. Scientists have been creating bionic arms, genetically improved animals and have even suggested the idea of digital immortality. What is digital immortality? Digital immortality is the reconstruction of a personality in digital form. It is evident that people want to live forever, although it has never been considered a realistic option. It has always been the subject of fiction. With improved technology, it is becoming more probable. The Allen Institute in Seattle finished the recreation of a mouse brain on a computer in May 2020. This brain computer can react to images and is the largest brain recreation on a computer to date. LifeNot, another organisation working on digital immortality, is offering a service where you fill out a mind file online and upload facts and images about yourself. It collects all your data and stores it. So when the technology is created, they will be able to download this data into a computer, robot or new human form. We ask will this ever happen? Although there hasn't been much progress to date on the aspect of digital immortality, history has taught us that technology always improves. Stephen will talk about limb replacements. The use of limb replacements has been around since 1000 BC. We know this as a wood and leather toe was found from ancient Egypt. This gives us hope that in the future, the technology will improve and we will be able to create digital immortality. Is digital immortality our last hope? The historically species only survive for approximately 1 to 10 million years, which may seem unlike the long time that in the existence of Earth it is quite small. It is reasonable to presume humans will not be on the planet forever. This new technology may change that. Potentially, uploaded brains could last forever. The main uncertainty about digital immortality is whether the uploaded brain will be you. Will it be able to think and cause a robot or computer to talk and move, or will it be simply a copy of your brain? The Allen Institute ambition is to create a digital brain, for after you die, it simply feels like you are waking up from surgery. This will lead to a huge debate on the moral aspect of digital immortality. People will be cautious about digital brains as they could lead to a dystopian society. Although if these digital brains act as currently imagined, they could create a society with no loss and grief. Transhumanism is the enhancement of the human experiences or human bodies with technology. VU token discusses how virtual reality is a stepping zone mentally to physical transhumanism. They discuss that when you are experiencing virtual reality, in some cases you take on the shape of an avatar. This is a key stepping zone as it prepares people for a future where your body may be transhuman. It mentally prepares you for taking on a different form but still acting the same. They argue that people who have interacted with VR may be more open minded. Bostrom discusses the negative effects of virtual reality. He states that eyes tell the brain it is moving, but the ears tell the brain that the head is stationary, which can cause dizziness, headaches and sometimes even nausea. If this problem is solved, it could open a wide range of future activities that could be done with VR. One of the main uses would be medical training. Last year,

For us, transhumanism is of the utmost importance to the evolution of humanity and the continual growth of the human race,
due to the present, near future and long term threats that society is facing.
Transhumanism will be the key to our survival and we all need to get on board before it's too late.
We're going to convince you today on why transhumanism is our last hope.
Scientists have been creating bionic arms, genetically improved animals and have even suggested the idea of digital immortality.
Digital immortality is the reconstruction of a personality in digital form.
It is evident that people want to live forever, although it has never been considered a realistic option.
It has always been the subject of fiction.
With improved technology, it is becoming more probable.
The Allen Institute in Seattle finished the recreation of a mouse brain on a computer in May 2020.
This brain computer can react to images and is the largest brain recreation on a computer to date.
LifeNot, another organisation working on digital immortality, is offering a service where you fill out a mind file online
and upload facts and images about yourself.
It collects all your data and stores it.
So when the technology is created, they will be able to download this data into a computer, robot or new human form.
We ask will this ever happen?
Although there hasn't been much progress to date on the aspect of digital immortality, history has taught us that technology always improves.
Stephen will talk about limb replacements.
The use of limb replacements has been around since 1000 BC.
We know this as a wood and leather toe was found from ancient Egypt.
This gives us hope that in the future, the technology will improve and we will be able to create digital immortality.
Is digital immortality our last hope?
The historically species only survive for approximately 1 to 10 million years,
which may seem unlike the long time that in the existence of Earth it is quite small.

This new technology may change that.
Potentially, uploaded brains could last forever.
The main uncertainty about digital immortality is whether the uploaded brain will be you.

The Allen Institute ambition is to create a digital brain, for after you die, it simply feels like you are waking up from surgery.
This will lead to a huge debate on the moral aspect of digital immortality.
People will be cautious about digital brains as they could lead to a dystopian society.
Although if these digital brains act as currently imagined, they could create a society with no loss and grief.
Transhumanism is the enhancement of the human experiences or human bodies with technology.
VU token discusses how virtual reality is a stepping zone mentally to physical transhumanism.
They discuss that when you are experiencing virtual reality, in some cases you take on the shape of an avatar.
This is a key stepping zone as it prepares people for a future where your body may be transhuman.
It mentally prepares you for taking on a different form but still acting the same.
They argue that people who have interacted with VR may be more open minded.
Bostrom discusses the negative effects of virtual reality.
He states that eyes tell the brain it is moving, but the ears tell the brain that the head is stationary,
which can cause dizziness, headaches and sometimes even nausea.
If this problem is solved, it could open a wide range of future activities that could be done with VR.
One of the main uses would be medical training.
